content: <articles>    <article xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink/">   <front>     <article-meta>       <title-group>         <article-title>A novel method for spatio-temporal analysis of flows within the water-side viscous boundary layer</article-title>       </title-group>       <contrib-group>         <contrib contrib-type="author">           <name>             <surname>J\ufffd\ufffdhne</surname>             <given-names>Bernd</given-names>           </name>           <aff>             <institution>Interdisciplinary Center for Scientific Computing (IWR), Heidelberg University</institution>           </aff>         </contrib>         <contrib contrib-type="author">           <name>             <surname>Jehle</surname>             <given-names>Markus</given-names>           </name>           <aff>             <institution>Interdisciplinary Center for Scientific Computing (IWR), Heidelberg University</institution>           </aff>         </contrib>       </contrib-group>       <pub-date pub-type="pub">         <year>2006</year>       </pub-date>       <self-uri xlink:href="http://zenodo.org/record/14845"/>       <self-uri xlink:href="https://zenodo.org/record/14845/files/ISFV2006_Jehle.pdf"/>     </article-meta>     <abstract><p>A novel measurement technique is developed for 3D reconstruction of Eulerian velocity vector fields and Lagrangian trajectories at water-side viscous boundary layers in wavy free surfaces. The presented approach makes use of spatiotemporal image processing algorithms. The method is applied to a falling film with a known velocity profile.</p></abstract>   </front>   <article-type>user-asi</article-type> </article>   </articles>
